title: The Scottish cavalier;
author: Grant, James
snippet: The mos. substantial breakfast of these degenerate days would dwindle into insignificance when compared with that which loaded the long oaken table of Bruntisfield House. In the centre smoked a vast urn of coffee, surrounded by diminutive cups of dark-blue china, flanked on the right by a side of mutton roasted, on the left by a gigantic capon ; a dish of wild ducks balanced another of trout, both being furnished by the adjacent loch ; broiled haddocks, pickled salmon, kippered
